column4: hmm, i have a slight problem - i can't right click on my desktop.. any idea what's up?
is nautilus managing your desktop (ie you didn't disable it from doing so)?
i think i closed the thing that handles right clicking on background + desktop icons.. how can i restart it?
what does it say when you enter 'nautilus' in a terminal?
what exactly do you want to do?
execute two commands to start my RAID array on boot up so i can mount it on /home
you can use /etc/init.d/ and udpate-rc.d, you could also add it to /etc/rc.local maybe... I'm not sure when that gets executed though
but then i'd need to implement a stop command right?
I don't think so, see post 8 here http://ubuntu.wordpress.com/2005/09/07/adding-a-startup-script-to-be-run-at-bootup/
think i got it working, i'll know when i reboot :)
sanityx: you're both offtopic, please take it somewhere else
how did you create the user?
